intro: Delissea honolulensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian delissea, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Oahu in Hawaii. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, it is listed as endangered, making conservation efforts crucial for its survival. Its unique ecological role in Hawaiian ecosystems highlights the importance of protecting native flora.
